oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intercropping of cereals and grain legumes for increased production, weed control, im-proved product quality and prevention of N –losses in European organic farming systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jensen, Erik Stee
Ambus, Per
Bellostas, Natalia
Boisen, Sigurd
Brisson, Nadine
Corre-Hellou, Guanelle
Crozat, Yves
Dahlmann, Christoph
Dibet, Audry
von Fragstein, Peter
Gooding, Mike
Hauggaard-Nielsen, Henrik
Kasyanova, Elena
Monti, Michele
Pristeri, Aurelio
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop combinations and interactions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: – Intercropping of cereals and grain legumes is a technology to enhance biodiversity in organic agro-ecosystems, enhance and stabilize yields and make better use of plant growth resources. Here we report the preliminary results of the EU FP 5 research project “Intercrop” carried out in five European regions. The project demonstrates several significant benefits which could be exploited to a greater degree in European organic farming .
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jensen, Erik Stee; Ambus, Per; Bellostas, Natalia; Boisen, Sigurd; Brisson, Nadine; Corre-Hellou, Guanelle; Crozat, Yves; Dahlmann, Christoph; Dibet, Audry; von Fragstein, Peter; Gooding, Mike; Hauggaard-Nielsen, Henrik; Kasyanova, Elena; Monti, Michele and Pristeri, Aurelio (2006) Intercropping of cereals and grain legumes for increased production, weed control, im-proved product quality and prevention of N –losses in European organic farming systems. Paper at: Joint Organic Congress, Odense, Denmark, May 30-31, 2006.
